intro: Oyedaea buphthalmoides, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that resemble those of the buttercup genus. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open grasslands. Oyedaea buphthalmoides is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
